content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="FGDC_Plus.xsl"?> <metadata xmlns:fn="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions" xmlns:xdt="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-datatypes" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><onlink>http://www.landscape.blm.gov/COP_2010_layerpackages/COP_DV_C_4KM_poly.lpk</onlink><origin>Conservation Biology Institute</origin><pubdate>2011</pubdate><title>REA COP Current High Landscape Development</title><onlink /><pubinfo><pubplace>Unknown</pubplace><publish>CSS-Dynamac and Conservation Biology Institute (CBI)</publish></pubinfo></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>     This dataset provides a measure of current high development, as an integration of several factors representing landscape development.  This measure was calculated using a fuzzy logic model, which is represented in graphical format in \\Vector\\Change_Agents\\Development\\Documentation\\COP_DV_logic_models.pptx          This dataset represents the combination of energy, agriculture, urban, and recreation development.          Original source data were summarized to 4KM reporting unit, and converted to fuzzy values (rescaled on a -1 to 1 value range) for input to the fuzzy logic model. These data include: utility lines, pipelines (from BLM), oil/gas wells (from BLM), mines (from multiple sources), geothermal wells (from multiple sources), intensive agriculture (from LANDFIRE existing vegetation dataset), urban areas (from LANDFIRE existing vegetation dataset and NLCD impervious surfaces), grazing allotments (from USFS and BLM), ground transportation features (from BLM), recreation areas, sites, and travel corridors (compiled from BLM and USFS data sources for another management question in this REA).  See source information below for complete list of data sources.          The final measure of high development was calculated as the maximum of high energy development, high agricultural development, high urban development, and high recreational development.       </abstract><purpose>Created to support the BLM REA process</purpose></descript><timeperd><current>publication condition</srccurr></srctime><srcscale>Unknown</srcscale><typesrc>Digital media</typesrc><srccontr>Spatial and attribute information</srccontr></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>     Inputs were prepared and summarized for 4KM reporting units using the models: \\Models\\Conservation_Elements\\COP_TI.tbx\\COP_TI_PrepareInputs_4KM     COP_DV.tbx\\COP_DV_C_PrepareInputs_4km          Logic model was executed using the model: Models\\Change_Agents\\COP_DV.tbx\\COP_DV_C_4KM     The thresholds used to convert densities to fuzzy values are contained in this model.          This model is represented in graphical format in \\Vector\\Change_Agents\\Development\\Documentation\\COP_DV_logic_models.pptx              Source datasets were summarized into input factors as follows:          Utility line density: calculated density of COP_Utility_Lines_ln          Pipeline density: calculated density of COP_Pipelines_ln          Oil/Gas Well density: calculated density of COP_Oil_Gas_Wells_point          Mine density: merged COP_AZ_Mines_pt, COP_AZ_Uranium_Mines_pt, COP_CO_Mines_pt, COP_Mines_pt, COP_NM_Mines_pt, COP_UT_Mines_pt and calculated density          Geothermal well density: merged COP_UT_GeothermalWells_pt and COP_GeothermalWells_pt and calculated density          Intensive agriculture density: extracted agriculture classes from LANDFIRE EVT ("VALUE" in (60,63,64,65,66,82)) and calculated density          Grazing density: calculated density of COP_DV_C_Allotments_poly  (this is a combination of BLM and USFS grazing allotments)          Ground transportation density: calculated density of COP_BLM_GTLF_ln          Urban density: extracted urban classes from LANDFIRE EVT ("VALUE" in (13,14,15,16,17,21,23,24,25,32)), combined with NLCD impervious greater than 0, and calculated density          Recreational area density: calculated density of COP_DV_C_REC_LandRecAreas_poly          Recreational site density: calculated density of COP_DV_C_REC_LandRecSites_pt          Recreational travel corridor density: calculated density of COP_DV_C_REC_LandTravelCorridors_ln               Intermediates were calculated as follows:     Utility line and pipeline densities were summed together to create high linear energy development.          Oil/gas well, mine, and geothermal well densities were summed togetether to create high mineral / geothermal development.          Intensive agriculture and grazing densities were averaged (using Fuzzy Union operation) to create high agricultural development.          Ground transportation and urban densities were averaged (using Fuzzy Union operation) to create high urban development.          Recreation area, site, and travel corridor densities were averaged (using Fuzzy Union operation) to create high recreational development.          High linear energy development and high mineral / geothermal development were combined to create high energy development.               Final measure of high development was calculated as the maximum (using Fuzzy OR operation) of High energy development, high agricultural development, high urban development, and high recreational development.     </procdesc><procdate>2011</procdate><srcused>Vector\\Change_Agents\\Development\\Dev_Current\\COP_DV_C_Allotments.gdb\\COP_DV_C_Allotments_poly</srcused><srcused>Vector\\Change_Agents\\Development\\Dev_Current\\COP_DV_C_REC.gdb\\COP_DV_C_REC_LandRecAreas_poly</srcused><srcused>Vector\\Change_Agents\\Development\\Dev_Current\\COP_DV_C_REC.gdb\\COP_DV_C_REC_LandRecSites_pt</srcused><srcused>Vector\\Change_Agents\\Development\\Dev_Current\\COP_DV_C_REC.gdb\\COP_DV_C_REC_LandTravelCorridors_ln</srcused><srcused>Vector\\Existing_Source_Datasets\
